title: Softevia B2B SaaS landing page (Market Research Technology in Europe)

requirements.summary: Build a single-page, modern, high-conversion Softevia landing page with an enterprise look, blue/purple gradient accents, and AI/analytics-themed visuals.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders as a cohesive, responsive layout for mobile/tablet/desktop.
Visual styling consistently uses clean SaaS spacing/typography and blue/purple gradient accents (no conflicting themes).
Page includes at least one AI/analytics illustration and at least one dashboard UI mockup integrated into the layout (not just empty placeholders).

file_operations.description: Create the single-page landing layout and sections composition with a clean enterprise SaaS look and blue/purple gradient accents; integrate AI/analytics visual areas (illustration + dashboard mockup).
Add reusable section wrapper and spacing primitives to keep consistent typography, layout rhythm, and responsive behavior across the landing page.
Extend theme tokens (colors/gradients/shadows) to support the blue/purple gradient accent system and enterprise styling consistency.
Add global base styles for a clean SaaS look (typography defaults, background/foreground, smooth scroll, and consistent section spacing) without introducing conflicting themes.
Wire the Softevia single-page landing into the app root so it is rendered as the primary experience.

requirements.summary: Implement the exact required page structure and section content with the H1 exactly “Market Research Technology in Europe”.
acceptanceCriteria: Sections appear in this order: Hero, Evolution, About, Solutions/Capabilities (6 blocks), Why Choose (icon bullets), Industries (grid), How the Technology Works (step-by-step flow), Final CTA.

Hero section includes H1 exactly “Market Research Technology in Europe”, the specified subheading, and a short paragraph describing Softevia as an AI market research + predictive analytics technology provider using a digital market intelligence platform.
Solutions/Capabilities grid contains exactly 6 feature blocks with the provided titles and short technology-focused descriptions.
Why Choose section uses icon-style bullets and contains exactly the five points provided.
Industries section displays the 6 industries in a grid format with the exact labels provided.
How the Technology Works shows the 5 steps in a clear step-by-step visual flow with the exact step titles provided.
Final CTA includes a strong closing message aligned to the stated objective and presents both CTAs: “Request a Demo” (primary) and “Speak with an Expert” (secondary).

file_operations.description: Implement the required section order and exact user-facing English copy, including the H1 exactly “Market Research Technology in Europe”, specified subheading, the 6 capability blocks, 5 why-choose bullets, 6 industries labels, 5 how-it-works steps, and the final CTA copy + dual CTAs.
Create a dedicated 6-item capabilities grid component to ensure exactly six feature blocks with consistent layout and responsive behavior.
Create a step-by-step visual flow component for the 5 required steps with clear progression and responsive layout.
Create an industries grid component that renders exactly the 6 specified industry labels in a responsive grid.

requirements.summary: Add conversion-focused CTAs that open a shared lead-capture modal/section with validation and a success state; submit leads via the backend submitLead method.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking any “Request a Demo” CTA opens the same demo-request form experience.
Clicking “Speak with an Expert” opens the same form with the intent preselected as “Speak with an Expert” (or equivalent), without duplicating the entire UI.
Form includes at minimum: full name, work email, company, optional message, and an intent selector (Demo vs Expert).
Client-side validation prevents submission with missing required fields or invalid email format; validation messages are shown inline.
On successful submission, UI shows a non-technical confirmation message and clears/disables the form to prevent accidental resubmits.
No third-party email or CRM integrations are added; submissions are stored in the canister backend.

file_operations.description: Implement a reusable lead-capture modal using shadcn-ui Dialog to support shared UI for both CTAs with intent preselection. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the lead form UI (intent selector, full name, work email, company, optional message), inline validation messages, submit/disabled states, and a clear success confirmation message. Use shadcn-ui form inputs (Input/Textarea/Select/Button) by composing components without editing frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a React hook to submit lead data by calling the existing backendInterface submitLead via the app's actor hook (useActor), and return status (idle/submitting/success/error) to drive UI.
Wire all “Request a Demo” and “Speak with an Expert” CTAs (hero + final CTA + header CTA if present) to open the same LeadCaptureDialog instance; pass intent to preselect and avoid duplicating UI.
Ensure the actor returned is usable for anonymous visitors (no login required for lead submission) and can be consumed by the new lead submission hook without changing immutable auth behavior.

requirements.summary: Optimize on-page SEO for the keyword “Market Research Technology in Europe” with title/meta description and natural visible keyword usage including all provided related keywords.
acceptanceCriteria: The H1 is exactly “Market Research Technology in Europe”.
Page sets an SEO-friendly document title and meta description that include “Market Research Technology in Europe”.
All provided SEO keywords are included naturally at least once in visible page copy (not in hidden text).
Copy consistently positions Softevia as a technology provider (AI/automation/analytics) and explicitly not a traditional survey-based research agency.

file_operations.description: Update the document title and add a meta description that includes the exact keyword “Market Research Technology in Europe” and aligns with Softevia’s AI/analytics positioning.

Ensure visible copy naturally includes all provided related keywords at least once (AI market research, predictive analytics company, business intelligence solutions, data-driven market research, AI-powered business insights, customer insights analytics, competitor benchmarking services, market intelligence services, digital market intelligence platform) and clearly positions Softevia as a technology provider (not a traditional survey-based agency).

requirements.summary: Add a polished header/navigation and footer with smooth scrolling to sections and persistent access to primary CTAs.
acceptanceCriteria: Header includes Softevia wordmark (text-based is acceptable if no logo yet) and nav links that scroll to key sections (e.g., Solutions, Industries, How it Works).
Primary CTA is visible in the header on desktop (and accessible on mobile via a menu or sticky CTA).
Footer includes basic company/footer layout (e.g., brief positioning statement and links that scroll to sections).

file_operations.description: Implement a responsive header with Softevia wordmark, smooth-scroll nav links to in-page sections, and a persistent primary CTA that opens the shared lead-capture dialog. Use shadcn-ui Button and (optionally) Sheet for mobile navigation without editing frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement a B2B SaaS footer with a brief positioning statement and in-page links that smooth-scroll to key sections.
Wire the new Header and Footer into the landing page and ensure section IDs match nav links for smooth scrolling; ensure header CTA triggers the same lead-capture modal as other CTAs.
Enable smooth scrolling behavior globally and ensure anchor offsets/layout accommodate a sticky header for accurate section navigation.

requirements.summary: Add required static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and integrate at least one illustration and one dashboard mockup with descriptive alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are stored as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (not served from the backend).
At least one illustration and one dashboard mockup are displayed in the page layout, responsive and not distorted.
All images include descriptive alt text appropriate for accessibility and SEO.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static asset file to the project at the required path for the hero AI analytics illustration with a European motif.
Add the generated static asset file to the project at the required path for the SaaS dashboard UI mockup.
Add the generated static asset file to the project at the required path for the set of 6 minimal line icons for capabilities.

Reference and render the static assets frontend/public/assets/generated/softevia-hero-illustration.dim_1400x900.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/softevia-dashboard-mockup.dim_1600x1000.png in relevant sections (e.g., Hero and/or How it Works/Solutions) with responsive sizing and descriptive alt text.

Integrate the capabilities icon set from frontend/public/assets/generated/softevia-capability-icons.dim_512x512.png into the 6 capability blocks in a consistent, accessible way (e.g., mapped icon treatments) with appropriate alt/labels.
